article.title: Raytheon BBN Technologies To Defend Military Networks From Cyber Attacks
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: Raytheon BBN Technologies has been awarded a $2.9 million contract by the U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory to develop new methods to protect U.S. Defense Department service oriented architectures against malicious attacks. The goal of the Advanced Protected Services contract is to enable future military service oriented information systems to detect, protect and adapt to cyber attacks survive attacks.
